notes: Muehlenbachs, Spiller, & Timmins (2015), 'The Housing Market Impacts of Shale Gas Development'. DiD design exploiting timing of shale gas well drilling near properties in Pennsylvania. Property FE with repeat sales, county-by-year FE, quarter FE. Treatment heterogeneity by groundwater dependence (GW interaction). Multiple distance radii (K=1km, 1.5km, 2km, 2.5km, 3km). Full sample and boundary sample (narrow band around public water service area border).

design_audit.treatment_timing: Shale gas well pad drilling (spud date), varies by property-well pair
design_audit.sample_restriction: Repeat sales in Marcellus Shale region of PA, excluding new construction and sales in year built
design_audit.notes: xtreg logprice2012 post postGW npads npadsGW _IyeaXcou_* dq_2 dq_3 dq_4, i(property) fe robust cluster(censustractstatecounty). Treatment is `post` (well pads drilled within K km before sale), interacted with `GW` (groundwater dependence). `npads` controls for well pads within 20km. Focal parameter: `postGW` (differential effect for groundwater-dependent properties) or the linear combination `post + postGW` (total GW effect).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log residential property sale price (inflation-adjusted to 2012 dollars)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Proximity to shale gas well pads drilled before the sale date (within K km radius), interacted with groundwater dependence (GW)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ATT of nearby shale gas drilling on house prices, with differential effect for groundwater-dependent properties vs. those on piped water
claim_object.target_population: Repeat-sale residential properties in the Marcellus Shale region of Pennsylvania

baseline_specs.label: Table2-PanelA-K2km-Full
baseline_specs.notes: K=2km distance radius, full sample. post = pads in 2km before sale; postGW = post*GW; npads = pads in 20km; npadsGW = npads*GW. County-year and quarter FE absorbed.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-PanelA-K2km-Boundary
baseline_specs.notes: K=2km, boundary sample (band1000==1). Restricts to properties in narrow band around public water service area border.

constraints.notes: post, npads, npadsGW are always included. postGW is the focal treatment variable (not a control). GW itself is collinear with property FE. House characteristics are not included in the baseline (repeat-sales design absorbs them via property FE).

canonical.notes: Cluster-robust SE at census tract level, matching the paper.

budgets.notes: Most variation from distance radius (5 choices), sample (full/boundary/single-well), and treatment definition. Control variation is limited since property FE absorbs most cross-sectional differences.

sampling.notes: Small control pool beyond the mandatory regressors. Full enumeration is feasible.

diagnostics_plan.linkage: Table A7 uses permitted-but-undrilled wells as a placebo treatment
diagnostics_plan.notes: Permitted but not yet drilled well pads serve as a falsification test (should show no effect if identification is valid).
